Name: LU 733 - Zoning, 737 Fourth Avenue Rezoning, Brooklyn (C 200029 ZMK)
Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 200029 ZMK, a Zoning Map amendment (Preconsidered L.U. No. 733).

History.Action: Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee with Modifications and Referred to CPC
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f1\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset0 Courier;}{\f2\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Calibri;}{\f3\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Arial;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\b By Council Members Salamanca and Moya\b0\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx9360\tab WHEREAS, 737 Fourth Avenue, LLC, \expndtw-6 filed an application \expndtw0 pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section No. 16d, changing from an M1-1D District to an R8A District, establishing within the proposed R8A District a C2-4 District, and establishing a Special Enhanced Commercial District (EC-1), which in conjunction with the related action \cf1 would facilitate a mixed-use development\cf0\f1  \cf1\f0 containing \cf0 142 dwelling units, of which approximately 35 would be designated permanently affordable under Option 1 of the Mandatory Inclusionary Housing (MIH) Program, and approximately 8,600 square feet of commercial floor area on the ground floor, \cf1 at \cf0 737 Fourth Avenue in the Sunset Park neighborhood of Community District 7, Brooklyn (ULURP No. C 200029 ZMK), (the \ldblquote Application\rdblquote );\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720\tx3420\f2\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720\f0 WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on February 19, 2021, its decision dated February 3, 2021 (the "Decision") on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tqr\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx810\tab WHEREAS, the Application is related to application N 200030 ZRK (Pre. L.U. No. 734), a zoning text amendment to designate an MIH area with Options 1 and 2, and to include the Project Area within the EC-1 District;\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720\f2\par
\f0 WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720 WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on February 23, 2021;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720 WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720 WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the negative declaration issued August 17\super th\nosupersub , 2020 (CEQR No. \cf1 19DCP127K\cf0 ), which includes an (E) designation to avoid the potential for significant adverse impacts related to hazardous materials, air quality, and noise (E-575) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1260\tx1440\tx1620\par
RESOLVED:\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720 The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the environment as set forth in the (E) Designation (E-575) and Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\tx720 Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 200029\fs22  ZMK\fs24 , incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission.\par
\pard\ltrpar\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri140\qj\tx720\tx7560 The Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, effective as of December 15, 1961, and as subsequently amended, is further amended by changing the Zoning Map, Section No. 16d: \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li720\qj\tx720\lang4105 1.\tab changing from an M1-1D District to an R8A District property bounded by 24\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Street, a line 100 feet southeasterly of 4th Avenue, 25\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Street, and 4\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Avenue;  \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi60\li1080\qj\f3\fs18\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li720\qj\tx720\f0\fs24 2.\tab establishing within the proposed R8A District a C2-4 District bounded by 24\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Street, a line 100 feet southeasterly of 4th Avenue, 25\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Street, and 4\super\fs19 th\nosupersub\fs24  Avenue;  \par
\pard\ltrpar\fi60\qj\f3\fs18\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li720\qj\tx720\f0\fs24 3.\tab establishing a Special Enhanced Commercial District (EC-1) bounded by 24\super th\nosupersub  Street, a line 100 feet southeasterly of 4th Avenue, 25\super th\nosupersub  Street, and 4\super th\nosupersub  Avenue;  \par
\pard\ltrpar\li720\qj  \f3\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\cf1\lang1033\f0 as shown on a diagram (for illustrative purposes \cf0 only) dated September 14, 2020, and subject to the conditions of the CEQR Declaration E-575, \cf1 Borough of Brooklyn, Community District 7.\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi-720\li720\qj\tx720\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj Adopted.\par
\par
\tab Office of the City Clerk,\}\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj The City of New York,\} ss.:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1440\qj I hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy of a Resolution passed by The Council of The City of New York on April 22, 2021, on file in this office.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\par
\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qr .....................................................\par
City Clerk, Clerk of The Council\fs32\par
